summary: An email from an unidentified sender to an unidentified recipient, sent on July 22, 2008, indicating the sender has discovered something 'very disturbing' in the Epstein case and wishes to speak with the recipient, who is on vacation. The email includes the address for an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Potential recipient or subject of the email
persons.context: The email includes the address for an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida, suggesting the communication may be directed to or concerns this legal official.

events.title: Disturbing Discovery Email
events.description: An email is sent stating the sender has just found out something 'very disturbing' in the Epstein case and asks the recipient, who is on vacation, if they have time to talk.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: An email dated July 22, 2008, references a 'very disturbing' discovery in the Epstein case.
The communication suggests an ongoing investigation or internal discussion about the Epstein case in mid-2008.
The email includes the professional address of an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida, linking the correspondence to the official legal proceedings.
The recipient is noted to be on vacation, indicating the urgency or sensitivity of the information.
